episodes.title: Episode One - Mission to the Unknown

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The planet Kembel, its landmasses covered in vast inhospitable jungles holding many dangers. In a forest clearing, Jeff Garvey is lying on the ground, barely conscious. Garvey wakes with a start, sitting up and peering about him in confusion. Quite suddenly, Garvey presses his hands to his temples, his face twisted in agony. At last the pain passes. Garvey becomes calmer, dropping his hands as he begins to smile. Rising to his feet, Garvey pulls a gun from his belt.

Dialogue.Line: I, I remember now. I must, I must kill. Must kill. Must kill.

metadata.title: Awakening in the Jungle
metadata.description: The scene unfolds in a vast and inhospitable jungle on the planet Kembel, where Jeff Garvey lies unconscious on the ground. As he wakes, confusion marks his expression, followed by a sudden surge of agony as he presses his hands to his temples. After a tense moment, the pain subsides, and a calm smile replaces his earlier distress. Rising to his feet with renewed purpose, Garvey retrieves a gun from his belt, revealing a chilling determination as he declares his intention to kill.

events.title: Jeff Garvey Regains Consciousness and Decision to Kill
events.description: In a jungle clearing on the inhospitable planet Kembel, Jeff Garvey lies on the ground, barely conscious. He suddenly wakes up, confused and alarmed, pressing his hands to his temples in pain. After enduring the agony, he calms down and begins to smile as he recalls his purpose. Rising to his feet, he pulls a gun from his belt, determined to kill.
key_dialogue: I, I remember now. I must, I must kill. Must kill. Must kill.

agent_participations.current_status: Garvey regains consciousness and stands up, pulling a gun from his belt.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Confused turning to calm and determined.
active_plans: To kill
beliefs: He must carry out his purpose to kill.
goals: To fulfill the mission of killing.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The gun is pulled from Garvey's belt, signifying his intent to kill and marking a shift in his character from confusion to determination. It serves as the instrument of his violent purpose as he recovers his resolve to kill.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The gun is holstered on Jeff Garvey's belt, unused and merely a piece of equipment.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The gun is drawn and ready for use as Jeff Garvey stands up, indicating his decision to engage in violence.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A short distance away, Marc Cory and Gordon Lowery are attempting to repair their rocket ship. Grimly, Lowery peers out into the surrounding jungle.

Dialogue.Line: Why you ever wanted to land on a planet like this in the first place I'll never know. This is getting on my nerves.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A loud screech

Dialogue.Line: I hate to think what kind of an animal makes a noise like that.
Yeah, they're getting closer.
Yes, all the more reason to stop talking and get on with the job.

Just you listen to me, Cory. I know my orders were to let you have full reign, and you've certainly taken advantage of that, but as Captain of this expedition, my first responsibility is to get this ship off the ground. So just cut the chat. Some other time, hmm? Bring that wrench.
How's it going?
Oh, it's slow. Flare-back melted the retaining bolts. Just solid lumps of tarnium. Ah, some of it's free.
I want to have a look around.
If we don't shoot off soon, we won't make it to the rendezvous with the freighter, you know? If we're not in the pick-up orbit, they won't wait.
You'll make it, Lowery. Here you are.
I'm doing the best I can. I didn't want to touch down on this lousy planet in the first place, remember?
Let's not start that again. Just get on with the job, would you? Where the devil's Garvey? He should be back by now.
He'll be here. That screwdriver, will you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cory hands Lowery the requested tool. Hidden in the dense foliage of the jungle, Garvey watches the two men continue working on the rocket's tail fin.

Dialogue.Line: Kill. Kill.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He edges forward

Dialogue.Line: Ah, managed to get some of it free. Look at it, it's useless. Get me a spare, will you? No, in the ship.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As Cory heads back into the rocket, Lowery continues to work. Garvey edges closer, keeping the ship between him and the two other men so that he cannot be seen.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, it's no good, Cory. You needn't bother with a spare. I'm just not going to be able to fix it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bent over his work, Lowery is defenceless as Garvey raises his gun to fire. But it is Garvey who topples to the ground, caught in the blast of Marc Cory's ray gun.

Dialogue.Line: Jeff! Jeff!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery kneels beside Garvey, cradling his head. The fallen man writhes with pain and then lies still.

Dialogue.Line: You've killed him. You've killed Jeff!
It was him or you.
You didn't give him a chance. You shot him down like an animal. You just shot him down!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery launches himself at Cory, trying to strangle him. Cory punches him in the stomach. Lowery reels back, shocked and gasping, as Cory kneels down besides Garvey's body. He makes a cursory examination of the head and neck, and then with a grunt of recognition, removes a long thorn embedded in the flesh just below the ear.

Dialogue.Line: A Varga thorn.
What? Varga?
Careful, don't prick yourself with it or you'll end up the way Garvey is. I'd have to kill you.
What do you mean?
Let's get back into the ship.
What about his personal effects?
All right, but hurry up.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery collects Garvey's belongings then he and Cory disappear into the rocket ship, the door sliding shut behind them. Garvey lies on the ground where he fell, apparently dead. After a moment or two, however, the fingers of one hand begin to twitch and clench, the movement becoming more pronounced and violent. As the hand twists and turns, long white hair can be seen to be covering its back, and amongst the hair a multitude of spiny Varga thorns are growing.

metadata.title: Desperate Repairs in the Jungle
metadata.description: In the dense foliage of Kembel, Space Security agents Marc Cory and Gordon Lowery are struggling to repair their damaged rocket ship amidst the unsettling sounds of the jungle. Lowery expresses frustration over their precarious situation, while Cory urges him to focus on the repairs. As tensions rise between them, they are unaware that Garvey, a lurking figure driven by a compulsion to kill, is watching. When Garvey attempts to take action, it leads to an unexpected turn of events that ends with his own demise at the hands of Cory. As Lowery mourns his fallen comrade Jeff Garvey, an unsettling transformation begins to take place with Garvey's body, revealing the dangerous Varga thorns that now threaten them all.

events.title: Gordon Lowery Expresses Frustration
events.description: Gordon Lowery expresses his irritation at being stranded on the hostile planet while attempting to repair the rocket ship.
key_dialogue: Why you ever wanted to land on a planet like this in the first place I'll never know. This is getting on my nerves.

events.title: Marc Cory Senses Danger
events.description: Marc Cory comments on the strange noise from the jungle, expressing concern about the potential dangerous animals lurking nearby.
key_dialogue: I hate to think what kind of an animal makes a noise like that.

events.title: Lowery Insists on Focus
events.description: Gordon Lowery chastises Cory for talking too much and insists that they need to put their focus on the repairs to get the ship off the ground.
key_dialogue: Listen to me, Cory. I know my orders were to let you have full reign, and you've certainly taken advantage of that, but as Captain of this expedition, my first responsibility is to get this ship off the ground.

events.title: Cory Wants to Explore
events.description: Marc Cory expresses his desire to have a look around instead of focusing only on the ship's repairs, leading to a potential conflict with Lowery.
key_dialogue: I want to have a look around.

events.title: Lowery Urges Action
events.description: As the situation heats up, Lowery insists that they need to leave the planet quickly to meet their rendezvous with the freighter.
key_dialogue: If we don't shoot off soon, we won't make it to the rendezvous with the freighter, you know?

events.title: Garvey's Threat is Revealed
events.description: Jeff Garvey, hidden in the jungle, watches Cory and Lowery as they work on the rocket. He becomes fixated on the idea of killing them.
key_dialogue: Kill. Kill.

events.title: Cory Hears Signs of Progress
events.description: Lowery announces that he has managed to free some of the tarnium that was stuck, indicating improvement in their repairs.
key_dialogue: Ah, managed to get some of it free.

events.title: Cory Aids Lowery
events.description: Marc Cory assists Gordon Lowery with the repairs, handing him the required tools during the repair process.
key_dialogue: Here you are.

events.title: Garvey's Fatal Intent
events.description: Hidden in the jungle, Jeff Garvey waits for the moment to strike as he prepares to attack Lowery.

events.title: Cory Defends Himself
events.description: As Garvey attacks Lowery, Marc Cory, seeing the danger, uses his ray gun to shoot Garvey, causing a fatal injury and leading to a conflict between him and Lowery.
key_dialogue: You've killed him. You've killed Jeff!
It was him or you.

events.title: Lowery's Anguish
events.description: Gordon Lowery cradles dying Jeff Garvey's body and laments Cory's choice to shoot him without offering Garvey a chance.
key_dialogue: You didn't give him a chance. You shot him down like an animal.

events.title: Cory Examines Garvey
events.description: Marc Cory examines Garvey's body, discovering the cause of death and identifying a Varga thorn embedded in Garvey's flesh.
key_dialogue: A Varga thorn.

events.title: Return to Ship
events.description: Cory and Lowery decide to leave Garvey's body behind and return to the rocket ship, aware of the impending danger in the jungle.
key_dialogue: Let's get back into the ship.

events.title: Garvey's Transformation
events.description: After Cory and Lowery leave, Garvey's body starts to twitch, and long white hair along with multiple spiny Varga thorns begin to grow from his skin.

Dialogue.Line: I didn't intend to tell you anything, but since we're stuck on this planet and Garvey's dead, there are some facts that you're entitled to know.
Yeah. Jeff Garvey's dead. I mean, we flew together the last ten years, and now he's dead, and you killed him. You'd better explain that fact, and make it good.
Sit down and take a look at this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cory hand Lowery his ID.

Dialogue.Line: I might have known. Space Security Service. Licensed to kill.
That's right.
Well, count me out.
This other document gives me the authority to enlist the aid of any persons, civil or military. You were just enlisted. From now on, Lowery, you can take your orders from me.
All right, all right. But I don't fully understand. Better fill in a few details.
All right. I suppose you've heard of the Daleks?
The Daleks invaded Earth a thousand years ago.

That's right. Well, they haven't been active in our galaxy for some time now, but that doesn't mean they've exactly been sitting around. In the last five hundred years, they've gained control of over seventy planets in Ninth Galactic System and forty more in the Constellation of Miros.
Don't see why that should concern us. I mean, they're both millions of light years away from our galaxy.

Hmm, that's what we all thought. But about a week ago we had a report from the captain of a space freighter. His navigator spotted a space ship of a type never before used in our system. He saw it only for a second but he gave us a good description.
So?
What he described was a Dalek spaceship.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Outside the ship, Garvey's feet and legs are twitching with life, and from the waist up his body is covered in long white spines. All resemblance to the human that was once Garvey is disappearing. He's becoming a Varga. Inside, Cory tries to make contact with the rendezvous ship.

Dialogue.Line: Freighter XM2, freighter XM2. Come in, please. Come in, please!
Can you make it work?
It's got to work!
It may have been damaged in the crash.
We must keep on trying.
You tested the link pulses?
I know what I'm doing.
All right, all right, so the link pulses work. There could be something else wrong with it. What about the vergometer? Have you tested that? Without that you'd never break through the atmosphere.

How can I possibly test that? We've just got to take our chance that it hasn't been damaged. Freighter XM2. Freighter XM2. Come in, please. Come in, please. (static) It's useless. Are you sure we can't repair this ship?
Oh, not a chance. So you think that the Daleks have established some sort of a base here, is that it?

It could be. This is the most hostile planet in the universe. People from other civilisations avoid it. I suddenly had a hunch that this might make an ideal place for any secret preparations that the Daleks wanted to make. That's why we brought this ship down here.
Did you tell anybody else about this hunch of yours?
No one. Not even your commander. I just asked for a couple of men and a small rocket. I didn't even tell him what for.
Then why are you telling me?

Because of this. A thorn from a Varga plant. A thing part animal, part vegetable. Looks like a cactus. The poison attacks the brain. Rational thought is replaced by an overwhelming desire to kill. Eventually the poison seeps through the system and the victim is gradually transformed into a Varga.
And what's that got to do with the Daleks?
The only place in the universe where Vargas grow naturally is on the Daleks' own planet, Skaro. If the Vargas are here, the Daleks are, too.

metadata.title: Confronting the Unknown
metadata.description: In the interior of a damaged space ship, Space Security agent Marc Cory and his companion Gordon Lowery navigate a high-stakes discussion following the death of their companion Jeff Garvey. Cory reveals critical information about the Daleks, hinting at their active presence in the galaxy. The tension escalates as Cory attempts to establish communication with a rendezvous ship, while anxiety looms over the potential threat the Daleks pose. Outside, Garvey's body undergoes a horrifying transformation into a Varga, foreshadowing the very real dangers they face ahead.

events.title: Cory Reveals His Identity
events.description: Cory explains to Lowery that, given their current predicament and the death of Garvey, he must share critical information as a member of the Space Security Service, attempting to assert his authority.
key_dialogue: I didn't intend to tell you anything, but since we're stuck on this planet and Garvey's dead, there are some facts that you're entitled to know.
That's right.

events.title: Lowery Questions Cory
events.description: Lowery expresses his anger at Cory for Garvey's death and insists on an explanation. Cory tries to maintain control of the situation by showing his ID and authority.
key_dialogue: Yeah. Jeff Garvey's dead. I mean, we flew together the last ten years, and now he's dead, and you killed him.

events.title: Cory Asserts Authority
events.description: Cory hands Lowery his ID and asserts that he has the authority to command him as they navigate their perilous situation.
key_dialogue: This other document gives me the authority to enlist the aid of any persons, civil or military. You were just enlisted.

events.title: Discussion of the Daleks
events.description: Cory brings up the topic of the Daleks and their recent activities to inform Lowery of the potential threat they pose.
key_dialogue: All right. I suppose you've heard of the Daleks?
That's right. Well, they haven't been active in our galaxy for some time now, but that doesn't mean they've exactly been sitting around.

events.title: The Death of Garvey
events.description: As they talk, the scene shifts to outside the ship, where Garvey's transformation into a Varga begins as he loses all resemblance to his former self.

events.title: Cory Attempts Contact
events.description: Cory tries to establish contact with the freighter by calling out its designation over the communication system, indicating their urgent situation.
key_dialogue: Freighter XM2, freighter XM2. Come in, please. Come in, please!

events.title: Link Malfunctions
events.description: Lowery expresses doubts about the communications link, raising concerns that it may have been damaged in the crash.
key_dialogue: Can you make it work?
It may have been damaged in the crash.

events.title: Cory's Determination
events.description: Despite Lowery's concerns, Cory insists on trying to establish contact and remains determined to make the link work.
key_dialogue: We've just got to take our chance that it hasn't been damaged.
I know what I'm doing.

events.title: Discussion On Rescue
events.description: Cory and Lowery discuss the possibility of the Daleks establishing a base on Kembel, revealing Cory's fears and suspicions about the situation.
key_dialogue: So you think that the Daleks have established some sort of a base here, is that it?
It could be. This is the most hostile planet in the universe.

events.title: Cory's Secret Mission
events.description: Cory reveals that he acted on his own accord to investigate the Daleks, without informing his superiors, thus revealing his secret mission.
key_dialogue: No one. Not even your commander. I just asked for a couple of men and a small rocket. I didn't even tell him what for.

events.title: Cory's Warning about Vargas
events.description: Cory informs Lowery about the danger posed by Vargas and explains how the parasite can transform its victims into horrifying plant creatures.
key_dialogue: The only place in the universe where Vargas grow naturally is on the Daleks' own planet, Skaro.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cory's hunch is correct. There is indeed a Dalek base on Kembel. The machine creatures gather in the main control room as the Dalek Supreme enters and prepares to be updated on the latest developments. The Supreme's casing is jet black in contrast to the gunmetal blue-grey and silver of the others.

Dialogue.Line: I will receive your reports. First, space monitor control.
Space monitor control. The emissaries from the seven planets will arrive as arranged.
Then the conference will begin at first sun. Security report.
Security control. Position of alien space craft located. Our patrol will reach it shortly.
The ship and its occupants must be totally destroyed. Destroyed! Destroyed!
It will be done.

metadata.title: The Dalek Supreme's Directive
metadata.description: In the Dalek control room situated within a hidden base on Kembel, the Dalek Supreme, a towering black figure, prepares to receive updates from its subordinate Daleks. The atmosphere is tense as the other Daleks, in their gunmetal blue-grey and silver casings, gather around; their mechanical forms contrast starkly with the Supreme's jet black casing. The Supreme demands reports regarding the status of their operations. Dalek 1 informs the Supreme that emissaries from seven planets are on schedule and will arrive as planned. The Supreme, looming with authority, states that the conference will commence at first sun. Proceeding to security matters, Dalek 2 reports that an alien spacecraft has been located and they are close to reaching it. The Supreme's demeanor darkens as it commands that the ship and its occupants must be 'totally destroyed', emphasizing the order with repeated 'Destroyed!' commands, affirming the ruthlessness of their mission. Dalek 2 acknowledges the order.

events.title: Dalek Supreme Receives Reports
events.description: The Dalek Supreme enters the control room, preparing to be updated on the current situation. The Supreme, distinguished by its jet black casing, stands out among the other Daleks, which are of gunmetal blue-grey and silver. The Supreme commands for reports to be given.Commencing with space monitor control, Dalek 1 confirms that the emissaries from the seven planets will arrive as arranged. The Dalek Supreme then instructs for a security report.
key_dialogue: I will receive your reports. First, space monitor control.
The emissaries from the seven planets will arrive as arranged.

events.title: Security Reports on Alien Spacecraft
events.description: Following the space monitor report, the Dalek Supreme asks for a security update. Dalek 2 reports that the position of the alien spacecraft has been located, and assures the Supreme that their patrol will reach it shortly. The Supreme immediately orders that the ship and its occupants must be totally destroyed.
key_dialogue: Security report.
Position of alien space craft located. Our patrol will reach it shortly.
The ship and its occupants must be totally destroyed. Destroyed! Destroyed!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery and Cory are both outside the rocket ship, observed from the fringes of the clearing by three Vargas, which sway slightly from side to side as they wait. Lowery is preparing a rescue beacon, a small metal framework with capsule launcher, while Cory makes a circuit of the ship. Lowery looks up as he returns.

Dialogue.Line: Anything out there?
Vargas. They're closing in.
Do you mean to say they can move?
Very slowly. Look. They're using their roots to drag themselves along. How long are you going to be with this rescue beacon?
This is the recording part. Let's hope it wasn't damaged in the crash.
We'll soon find out. Can you fix this capsule up?

Well that's easy enough, but this is the recording mechanism for the message. If we sent the rocket into space without this, not only would we not be rescued, but as you pointed out earlier, no one would even know we were here.
Hurry up and attach it then.
All right, all right, I'm as keen to get out of here as you are. Give me those pliers, will you? Nearly finished.
Good. I don't know how long we've got. But the Daleks must know we're here. They'll be coming for us soon.
Well I still think you're jumping to conclusions, you know. I mean, just because these, what are they, Varga things grow here, it's no proof that the Daleks are here too.
Take my word for it, they're here all right.
Yes, but couldn't these Varga things grow here naturally? I mean, it's possible, isn't it?
No. They were developed in Dalek laboratories. They grow them to give themselves protection.
Well if they're synthetic, that means we
Look, stop asking questions and get on with the work!

metadata.title: The Varga Threat
metadata.description: Outside the rocket ship, in a clearing surrounded by danger, Cory makes a circuit of the ship while Lowery hurriedly assembles a rescue beacon. Meanwhile, they are observed by three creeping Vargas hidden in the fringes of the clearing, their roots dragging along the ground. Lowery expresses concern over the beacon’s recording mechanism as they realize the Vargas are closing in. Cory insists they need to hurry, believing Daleks are nearby, while Lowery doubts the immediate threat, suggesting the Varga may grow naturally. The tension builds as Cory insists that the Varga were developed by the Daleks for protection, raising urgency about their situation.

events.title: Garvey Observes Vargas Approaching
events.description: Lowery, outside the rocket ship, prepares a rescue beacon while Cory makes a circuit of the ship. As Cory returns, Lowery asks if there's anything out there, to which Cory responds that Vargas are closing in.
key_dialogue: LOWERY: Anything out there?
CORY: Vargas. They're closing in.

events.title: Lowery Questions Efficacy of Rescue Beacon
events.description: Lowery asks Cory if he means to say the Vargas can move, expressing disbelief as Cory confirms they can drag themselves along using their roots. Lowery continues assembling the rescue beacon, worried they won't be rescued if they send the rocket without the recording mechanism.
key_dialogue: LOWERY: Do you mean to say they can move?
CORY: Very slowly. Look. They're using their roots to drag themselves along.

events.title: Cory Urges Lowery to Attach Mechanism
events.description: Cory urges Lowery to hurry up and attach the recording mechanism to the rescue beacon. Lowery expresses his eagerness to complete the work while assuring Cory that he is nearly finished.
key_dialogue: CORY: Hurry up and attach it then.
LOWERY: All right, all right, I'm as keen to get out of here as you are.

events.title: Cory Expresses Urgency of their Situation
events.description: Cory expresses his urgency regarding their situation, indicating that he doesn't know how long they have before the Daleks come for them.
key_dialogue: CORY: Good. I don't know how long we've got. But the Daleks must know we're here. They'll be coming for us soon.

events.title: Lowery Disagrees with Cory's Conclusion
events.description: Lowery expresses skepticism about Cory's conclusion that the Daleks are coming for them just because the Varga plants grow in the area. He contemplates the natural growth of the Varga on Kembel.
key_dialogue: LOWERY: Well I still think you're jumping to conclusions, you know. I mean, just because these, what are they, Varga things grow here, it's no proof that the Daleks are here too.

events.title: Cory Provides Evidence of Dalek Development
events.description: Cory insists that the Varga plants were developed in Dalek laboratories for protection, concluding that the Daleks must be present in the area, directly worried about their situation.
key_dialogue: CORY: Take my word for it, they're here all right.
LOWERY: Yes, but couldn't these Varga things grow here naturally? I mean, it's possible, isn't it?

beliefs: The Varga creatures may not be a serious threat.
Wait for evidence of Dalek presence before panicking.
goals: Successfully complete the rescue beacon.

active_plans: Warn Lowery about the Vargas closing in.
beliefs: The Daleks are likely to be behind the Varga plants.
Time is of the essence as danger approaches.
goals: Secure the area and prepare for potential danger.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Elsewhere in the jungle, the Dalek security patrol considers tactics.

Dialogue.Line: Acceptor readings indicated alien space craft. We will close on it from two directions.
We obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Daleks fan off in two groups

metadata.title: Dalek Patrol Tactics
metadata.description: In the dense jungle, a Dalek security patrol is strategizing their approach to an alien spacecraft. The atmosphere is tense with determination as the Daleks assess their tactics. Dalek 1 announces that they will close in on the target from two different directions, and the Daleks obediently respond, splitting into two distinct groups to execute their plan.

events.title: Dalek Security Patrol Plans Tactics
events.description: The Dalek security patrol analyzes their tactics in response to indications of an alien spacecraft. They decide to close in on the craft from two directions, showcasing their strategic approach to threats.
key_dialogue: Acceptor readings indicated alien space craft. We will close on it from two directions.
We obey.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: Dalek 1 analyzes the situation regarding the alien spacecraft and issues a command to close in from two directions, demonstrating its strategic role in the Dalek security patrol's response.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: Dalek 1 is in a stationary position, part of a security patrol assessing a potential threat.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Dalek 1 is now mobilizing with other Daleks, fanning off in one of the two groups towards the indicated target.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: Dalek 2 obeys the orders given by Dalek 1, showing its compliance as part of the Dalek security structure, participating in the tactical maneuver to close in on the alien craft.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: Dalek 2 is part of the same stationary security patrol as Dalek 1, awaiting orders.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Dalek 2 is now actively moving with the group towards the alien spacecraft, preparing to engage.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cory and Lowery, unaware of the greater danger, are more concerned with the threat of the Vargas, which are edging ever closer to the rocket ship.

Dialogue.Line: Those things are getting too close for comfort. I'll fix them.
It's no good, Lowery. They'll only grow again as fast as you can shoot them.
At least I'll have had a try at them.
Get back to the beacon. You sure it'll work?
Well, it should work. It's standard safety equipment on all rocket ships.
What does it do exactly?
Well, you record the message, SOS, on this, just like an ordinary tape recorder. The rocket launcher shoots it high into orbit. Once it's in orbit it transmits the message. Simple.
From what we know about the Daleks, we've got to be picked up.
Well, it's tuned in to a special frequency, and there are listening posts all over the galaxy. Our people should get the message.
And all we have to do is to stay alive until they get here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery continues to prepare the launcher. Then both men are startled by a sound overhead. As they stare upwards, a huge craft passes above them.

Dialogue.Line: That's the biggest rocket ship I've ever seen. It's like nothing we've got.
It's from an outer galaxy.
Yes, but what's it doing in a God-forsaken planet like this?
I don't know, but I'll tell you this. There's something very big going on here, and if the Daleks are involved you can bet your life our whole galaxy is in danger.

metadata.title: The Impending Threat of the Vargas
metadata.description: Outside the rocket ship, Cory and Lowery assess the threatening presence of the approaching Vargas. Lowery expresses concern about the proximity of the Vargas and insists on taking action to shoot them. Cory argues against the futility of Lowery's plan, highlighting that the Vargas regenerate quickly. They discuss the operation of a distress beacon that Lowery is preparing, emphasizing the urgency of getting a message out to their people regarding the Dalek threat. Their conversation is interrupted by the sight of a massive rocket ship passing overhead, prompting a realization of the larger danger at play, with Cory noting the involvement of the Daleks.

events.title: Lowery Expresses Intent to Shoot Vargas
events.description: Lowery expresses his concern about the approaching Vargas, stating that they are getting too close. He insists on taking action, planning to shoot them down despite Cory's skepticism about the effectiveness of this action.
key_dialogue: LOWERY: Those things are getting too close for comfort. I'll fix them.
CORY: It's no good, Lowery. They'll only grow again as fast as you can shoot them.

events.title: Lowery Discusses SOS Beacon Functionality
events.description: Lowery explains the workings of the SOS beacon they are preparing, detailing that it records a message which is then launched into orbit to transmit for help. Cory questions the efficacy of the beacon concerning the Daleks.
key_dialogue: CORY: Get back to the beacon. You sure it'll work?
LOWERY: Well, it should work. It's standard safety equipment on all rocket ships.
CORY: What does it do exactly?
LOWERY: Well, you record the message, SOS, on this, just like an ordinary tape recorder. The rocket launcher shoots it high into orbit. Once it's in orbit it transmits the message. Simple.

events.title: Lowery and Cory Radically Assess Their Situation
events.description: As Lowery continues prepping the launcher, both men are startled by the sound of a huge craft passing overhead, prompting a conversation about its origin and implications of a larger threat involving the Daleks, hinting at a significant danger to their galaxy.
key_dialogue: CORY: From what we know about the Daleks, we've got to be picked up.
LOWERY: Well, it's tuned in to a special frequency, and there are listening posts all over the galaxy. Our people should get the message.
CORY: And all we have to do is to stay alive until they get here.
LOWERY: That's the biggest rocket ship I've ever seen. It's like nothing we've got.
CORY: It's from an outer galaxy.
LOWERY: Yes, but what's it doing in a God-forsaken planet like this?
CORY: I don't know, but I'll tell you this. There's something very big going on here, and if the Daleks are involved you can bet your life our whole galaxy is in danger.

goals: Ensure that the SOS message reaches their allies.

goals: Be ready for any incoming attack from the Daleks or Vargas.

object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The SOS beacon remains prepared for use but has not yet been launched as the priority shifts due to the approaching threat.

object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The ray gun is holstered and not being used.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The ray gun is still holstered, unused as Lowery ultimately decides against shooting at the Vargas before addressing the SOS beacon.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek patrol has also observed the spaceship's arrival.

Dialogue.Line: The ship from the planet Gearon.
And the beginning of the Great Alliance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek's resume their advance, closing in on the rocket ship.

metadata.title: The Arrival of the Great Alliance
metadata.description: In a dense jungle environment, a group of Daleks observes the arrival of a spaceship from the planet Gearon. The atmosphere is tense as the Dalek patrol discusses the significance of this event. They recognize this ship as a strategic development marking the beginning of their plans for the Great Alliance, suggesting a forthcoming collaboration that poses a threat to their enemies. The Daleks resume their advance, closing in on the rocket ship, highlighting their relentless pursuit and intention to act on this new development.

events.title: Daleks Acknowledge Arrival of Gearon Ship
events.description: The Dalek patrol observes the arrival of the spaceship from Gearon, recognizing it as a significant event that marks the beginning of the Great Alliance.
key_dialogue: The ship from the planet Gearon.
And the beginning of the Great Alliance.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The Gearon ship arrives on Kembel, marked as a significant event by the Dalek patrol, heralding the beginning of the Great Alliance.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The Gearon ship was in transit, traveling through space towards Kembel.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The Gearon ship is now landed on Kembel, recognized by the Daleks as a crucial part of their plans.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The Dalek patrol acknowledges the arrival of the Gearon ship as the initiation of the Great Alliance, signifying an important strategic collaboration.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The concept of the Great Alliance existed only as a plan among Daleks and their allies.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The Great Alliance is now actively in motion, indicated by the arrival of the Gearon ship heralding further actions.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Meanwhile, Lowery has finally finished assembling the launcher for the beacon.

Dialogue.Line: That should just about do it. Give me the capsule will you, I'll record the message.
Shush.
What is it?
There's something out there moving.
Vargas?
No. Moving too quickly. Come on, we've got to get away.
What about the distress signal?
We'll take it with us, launch it as soon as we get a chance.
All right. Which way?
Over here. They won't be the only ones, so watch out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A sudden noise makes Lowery turn.

Dialogue.Line: Cory! Daleks!

Get down and don't make a sound! (Crouched in the bushes, Cory and Lowery watch as two Daleks glide past them and into the clearing. They're soon joined by two more. The Daleks line up in front of the rocket ship whilst one glides up to the doorway and checks inside before turning to face the others.
The ship is empty. The crew has gone.
We will search for them. Destroy the ship. Fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lowery watches in horror as his ship is destroyed.

Dialogue.Line: It's just falling apart!
Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cory heads off deeper into the jungle. Lowery follows nervously, carrying the capsule launcher. All too aware that he's falling behind, Lowery pushes through a clump of dense bushes then recoils in alarm as if he has been stung. Horrified, he discovers he has a Varga thorn deeply embedded in the palm of his hand. Panicking, Lowery tears out the thorn and throws it aside, frantically sucking at the wound, trying to extract the poison.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, man, come on. They'll be looking for us now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hesitating only a moment, Lowery follows Cory into the jungle. Back in the clearing, the Daleks have totally destroyed the rocket ship.

Dialogue.Line: Report destruction of alien ship to control.
I obey.
Advise that we will now seek out the crew. Alert all patrols.
We obey.

metadata.title: The Destruction of the Rocket Ship
metadata.description: Outside the rocket ship, Lowery finishes assembling the distress signal launcher and instructs Cory to provide the capsule for recording their message. Cory, on edge, hears movement nearby and warns Lowery to be quiet as he suspects other threats in the jungle. Suddenly, they spot Daleks gliding into the clearing, checking the empty ship before issuing a destruction command. As the ship is obliterated, Cory urges Lowery to flee deeper into the jungle. In the chaos and panic, Lowery accidentally gets a Varga thorn embedded in his hand, but they do not have time to dwell on it. Bleeding and nervous, Lowery follows Cory as the Daleks prepare to search for them, having fully destroyed the ship.

key_dialogue: That should just about do it. Give me the capsule will you, I'll record the message.

events.title: Cory Senses Danger
events.description: Marc Cory warns Lowery that there's something moving nearby and suggests they should escape.
key_dialogue: Shush.
There's something out there moving.

key_dialogue: Come on, we've got to get away.
What about the distress signal?

events.title: Lowery Spots Daleks

key_dialogue: Cory! Daleks!
Get down and don't make a sound!

events.title: Daleks Discover Empty Ship
events.description: The Daleks check the empty ship that Cory and Lowery abandoned, and one Dalek declares it empty before ordering the destruction of the ship.
key_dialogue: The ship is empty. The crew has gone.
We will search for them. Destroy the ship. Fire!

events.title: Lowery's Ship is Destroyed

key_dialogue: It's just falling apart!

events.title: Cory Escapes Deeper Into Jungle
events.description: Cory urges Lowery to follow him deeper into the jungle to escape the Daleks, despite the danger lingering around them.
key_dialogue: Come on!
They'll be looking for us now!
